title: Mutabor Eagle-like logo
content:
Curious type was used for Mutabor’s logotype.

[http://www.mutabor.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184852/http:/www.mutabor.de/ "http://www.mutabor.de")

The “M” and the “A” are very distinct.

It resembles OPTI Eagle-Bold...but looks more finessed.

 [‹ (x) Everbloom logo - Kravitz Thermal {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184852/http:/typophile.com/node/19187 "Go to previous forum topic") [Serif type from non-profit association's website ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184852/http:/typophile.com/node/19191 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Matter Design

comments.content: Neutra is also similar, if tweaked.
It could be [FB Eagle](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184852/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Eagle) with a modified M...
There is a similar example, with more characters to reference, on [Demetrious Noble’s](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184852/http:/demetriousnoble.com/) website.
I think they’re different fonts but it’s difficult to say with tiny samples. I still think Mutabor is Font Bureau Eagle modified.

I would guess at a custom logotype, but for similar you could look at  
 [Engravers Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184852/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/engravers-gothic/)  
 [Mostra](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184852/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra/)  
 [Bahnhof](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184852/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/bahnhof/)  
 [Bovine](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503184852/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mvbfonts/mvb-bovine/)

Tim
